intro: Calandrinia menziesii var. alba, commonly known as the white-flowered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb with fleshy, succulent stems and leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and resilient member of the Portulacaceae family.
